baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of passing an operational revenue limit referendum on student academic outcomes, averaged over 10 post-election years. Estimated via Cellini et al. (2010) one-step dynamic RD at the 50% vote share cutoff, using Wisconsin school district panel data 1996-2014.
baseline_groups.expected_sign: positive for test scores and spending; negative for dropout rate
baseline_groups.notes: Six baseline outcomes span student achievement (advprof_math10, wkce_math10), dropout rate, postsecondary enrollment (log_instate_enr), and fiscal outcomes (rev_lim_mem, tot_exp_mem). The primary headline result is advprof_math10 (Table 5 Panel A Col 2). All use the Cellini one-step dynamic RD with cubic polynomial in vote share, district FE, and clustered SEs at district level. The claim object is shared: all measure the average 10-year effect of passing an operational referendum on different outcome dimensions for the same population.

global_notes: No changes to baseline group assignments relative to the surface. The surface correctly identified one baseline group (G1) covering six outcome variables under the same Cellini one-step dynamic RD design. The rdrobust_pre_placebo specifications (run0058-run0063) are classified as non-core because they test the null hypothesis of no pre-election effect -- these are falsification checks rather than core robustness tests of the main claim.
